name: A Quota Of Quotations Trivia Quiz | Quotes | 10 Questions

questions.text: 'Marriage is hardly a thing that one can do now and then, except in America.' Whose quote is this?
questions.explanation:
Oscar Wilde.

	A quote from 'The Picture of Dorian Gray'.

questions.text: 'Keep quiet, you're always interrupting me in the middle of my mistakes.' Whose quote is this?
questions.explanation:
Michael Curtiz (director).

	Michael Curtiz directed 'Casablanca' among many other movies.

questions.text: 'We're launching this innovation for the first time.' Whose quote?
'Sex appeal is 50 percent what you've got and 50 percent what people think you've got.' Whose quote ?
'Eternity's a terrible thought. I mean, where's it all going to end?' Whose quote is this?
'Gentlemen, include me out.' Whose quote is this?
questions.explanation:
Samuel Goldwyn.

	Dear Sam was great at putting his foot in his mouth. He produced this gem while resigning from the Motion Pictures Producers and Distributors of America.

questions.text: ' I may have my faults, but being wrong ain't one of them.' Whose quotes?
'Of course he was a wonderful allround man, but the act of walking round him always tired me.' Whose quote?
'It's the good girls who keep the diaries, the bad girls never have the time.' Whose quote?
'At Harvard, it took me ten years to achieve an environment of total hostility. In Washington DC I've done it in twenty months.' Whose quote?
